result.execSummary:
Christopher S Kroening was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Christopher S Kroening was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher S Kroening

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Called at 9:49 AM. Christopher Kroening appears in person and in custody without counsel. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. State provided copy of the fugitive complaint with the attachments to the defendant in Court. State - outstanding warrant from Iron County MI (2014000365 - 14-7349-FY) - warrant indicates what the defendant is charged with in that county/state. State has met its burden in regards to the validity of a felony warrant from the State of MI, believes the defendant wishes to waive extradition. Court finds the defendant is the individual listed on the felony warrant from MI. Kroening has a question regarding the habitual offender portion of the warrant. State/Court explains. Kroening waives further reading of the complaint. Court gives right to attorney. Kroening wishes to proceed without an attorney. Kroening asks what happens if he does not waive extradition. Court explains - governor's warrant will most likely be issued. Kroening waives extradition. Court finds sufficient facts to establish probable cuase that the defendant has been charged with a crime in another State. Court advises of right to counsel, court appointed or SPD. Kroening understands and will proceed on his own today. Court goes thru waiver of extradition hearing collaquey, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived extradition. Defendant wishes to be brought back to Michigan to answer to these charges. Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to counsel. Court reads waiver of extradition that requires defendant's signature. Kroening understands the document and will sign the waiver of extradition. Defendant signs the waiver of extradition. Court signs the waiver of extradition. Adjourned at 10:09 AM.
